svg.title: Anatomy of a Node — Rent Roll Analysis Node v3
svg.desc: Vertical exploded view showing the 7 internal sections of a governing node, using Rent Roll Analysis Node v3 as example, with a decision tree branch and a callout comparing traditional vs pinchfin methodology enforcement.
svg.text: RENT ROLL ANALYSIS NODE V3 — EXPLODED VIEW

g.text: What this node governs, boundaries, asset class applicability
scope: [multifamily, mixed-use, student, senior] | boundary: revenue_line_items_only
Industry body frameworks unified into one methodology
Step-by-step framework: inputs, execution order, decision trees
Market Rate Path — use in-place rents
Value Add Path — use stabilized rents
Required deliverables, narrative standards, table formats, red flag reporting
Completeness check, accuracy standards, blocking gates, QA integration
BLOCKING: Must pass before downstream phases consume output
Execution order, dependencies, and data flow between skills
25 years of institutional knowledge encoded as guardrails

text.tspan: ✘ "Never accept broker rents at face value"
✘ "Always derive lender rent first, then compare"
✘ "Concessions must reduce gross, not inflate net"
✘ "Min 3 comps per unit type or flag insufficient data"

g.text: Standards from FNMA, IREM, OCC, CCIM,
and CFA combined into one governing framework
Different deal types are automatically routed
to different execution paths by the node
Output must pass quality gates before any
downstream phase can consume the data
25 years of CRE expertise encoded as guardrails
A governing node is the authoritative document for a domain of underwriting analysis. It contains the methodology,
standards, decision logic, output specs, quality gates, skill map, and institutional safeguards in one unified file.
